title: Kasich, Philadelphia 76ers trade gibes
text:
Kasich, Philadelphia 76ers trade gibes By - Associated   
PHILADELPHIA (AP) - Republican presidential candidate John Kasich poked fun at the Philadelphia 76ers’ basketball talent. The team, in turn, made light of his low standing in the polls. 
The exchange happened Friday after the Ohio governor spotted the Sixers at his hotel. 
Appearing at a town hall in Manchester, New Hampshire, the Ohio governor talked about the importance of having job skills. The Philadelphia Inquirer (http://bit.ly/1Xp4PQi ) reports he then made fun of the Sixers’ basketball skills, saying of the team, “The reason why some of them make a lot of money is because they have skills. Not too many Sixers have had that many skills lately, but they do.” 
The Sixers immediately fired back on Twitter: “At least we win more than 2% of the time.” The tweet was later deleted. 
The Sixers are coming off an 18-64 season. 
Kasich didn’t seem to mind the gibe, tweeting a video that showed him draining a jump shot. The tweet said “just getting warmed up.” 
___ 
Information from: The Philadelphia Inquirer, http://www.inquirer.com
